channel.title: [PI] Just One Question
channel.description:
I've Tried Asking People At Rune - Server And Runelocus , But I Seem To Not Be Able To Get An Answer... So, I'm Going To Try Here. I Have A Problem With My Shops And The Items Not Lining Up On The Interface... I've Tried Everything That I Could Think Of And Came Up With Nothing.... I Really Hope Someone Can Help... Lol
Heres A Screenshot Of What I'm Talking About : [url=http://prntscr.com/6tgy3k]http://prntscr.com/6tgy3k[/url]
( I'm Using The VestigeX Source And Client. )

item.title: [PI] Just One Question
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551087”]Well. What it looks like is they threw the new shop interface over the old one, without actually editing it…

You need to get a tool like Lin’s Interface Editor (Note the link takes you to the last page, where an active download link is) and open your cache.

In the editor, click Interface > Select, and the type in the ID of the shop interface. (i believe it’s 3900).

After it loads, you need to select the item container from the right side (item containers are invisible. may be named as Model container or similar). When you click it, a bunch of values should load up…

Next, just move the item container down like 30 pixels (as that’s about how far it’s off). Then save/export. It’ll export to an interface.dat file.

Now, open up tom’s cache editor. Make sure you close Lin’s interface editor, as it is “using” the cache. Open your cache in the cache editor, and repack the interface file.

to replace the interface.dat, go to view/edit jagex archives > interface.jag > replace data.dat (remember to hit Repack Archive!)[/quote]
He has the solution if the problem is in the cache. If it is a hard-code problem in the source you should search the RSInterface class for the shop interface, one of the values set will be an offset.
If you remove it, the cache’s value will be used again.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Just One Question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well. What it looks like is they threw the new shop interface over the old one, without actually editing it…

You need to get a tool like Lin’s Interface Editor (Note the link takes you to the last page, where an active download link is) and open your cache.

In the editor, click Interface > Select, and the type in the ID of the shop interface. (i believe it’s 3900).

After it loads, you need to select the item container from the right side (item containers are invisible. may be named as Model container or similar). When you click it, a bunch of values should load up…

Next, just move the item container down like 30 pixels (as that’s about how far it’s off). Then save/export. It’ll export to an interface.dat file.

Now, open up tom’s cache editor. Make sure you close Lin’s interface editor, as it is “using” the cache. Open your cache in the cache editor, and repack the interface file.

to replace the interface.dat, go to view/edit jagex archives > interface.jag > replace data.dat (remember to hit Repack Archive!)

Read full topic
